text: We came here for lunch a few weeks ago before heading over to the Picasso exhibit. I like the decor of the place and the fact that it's a great place for lunch that won't break the bank at the Bellagio. I had the tuna sandwich with wasabi mayo and my boyfriend had the foraged mushroom pesto pizza. I loved the tuna sandwich. My boyfriend liked the foraged mushroom pizza but thought they could have added a variety of fancy mushrooms to warrant the word "foraged" in the name and to make it taste better. There was only one type of mushroom in the pizza originally.  He brought up his suggestion to the manager there and she then had him speak to the chef.  We weren't sure if anything was going to be done about it but we found out today that they now have a variety of mushrooms in their foraged mushroom pesto pizza! It's good to know that the management really takes the patrons' suggestions to heart. Thus, the 5 star rating. We also appreciate the great customer service and the nice, clean environment of Snacks.
Katsu burger makes this restaurant a 5! Delicious! Garlic sweet potato fries- great pair with the katsu burger!
Good spot for quick fast food style food (burgers, pizzas nachos etc) if you're not looking for buffet style at Bellagio. Overpriced but that's to be expected for where it's located.
Snacks! Exactly that. Adult dinner price for kids meal sized burgers. Ordered a Salad which was more filling than the burger.

The line at the buffet was a little long and I didn't wanna spend $27.99 for breakfast so I came here to save some gambling money. Big mistake. First, I hate it when a restaurant that doesn't have waiter service has a "tip" section on their receipts. What am I tipping for? I crossed out the section and I always feel like I'm getting poorer service because of it.. maybe it's me...
I ordered a berry bowl and something called a "so cal" - which is basically eggs and kale. The berry bowl was full of u washed berries and leaves. The "so cal" took 20 minutes to make. Won't make this mistake again.
It's ok. Greasy food. Good when it's late and nothing else is open, but don't make it a destination.
This place is amazing. Tomato soup is fantastic and they have a really rich chocolate shake.

So. . 5 out of 5 times I have gone here. . I have had bad service,  but this last time takes the cake.. so,  I ordered a pepperoni pizza to go for my son ($30) at 10:30pm.. 30+ minutes later, I see the cook taking the pizza out of the oven,  then I see the pizza box sitting at the pass through and one of the counter guys grabs it,  heads to the counter area where the single slices are kept warm,  tosses some slices into the box, then my buzzer buzzes and I pick up the pizza. . Curious,  I open the box and discover that. . I wasnt given a whole pepperoni pizza.. somewhere between the pizza oven and the window,  1/3 of my pizza disappeared. .and the counter guy decided to slop in  random pizza slices to fill the gap. . Who does that? ? I'm paying $30 for a pizza and this guy not only doesn't give a crap,  but figures he can get away with it. . I asked to (once again) speak to the manager,  and she (once again) refunds my money.. my only conclusion is that since this place is right next to a night club full of drunk, hungry people,  they can get away with sleazy maneuvers, and nobody will notice. .. but. . FYI Snacks.. not everyone ordering is drunk and. .if I pay $30 for a WHOLE PIZZA.  I expect to get a WHOLE PIZZA

Charged $100 for $20 worth of food. Chicken wings were over cooked and you get six for $11 or $12. Nachos were just as bad and were more. Coke was $6. I wasn't expecting anything great but I would expect a little better for the price.

Wrote this review in the old listing & decided to add to this one. Have tried it a few times since first opening & my thoughts are still the same. 

Newly remodeled and reopened a few weeks ago with the addition of a brick oven & updated menu. You order on tablets when you go in. It prints a ticket that you bring to the counter to pay & get your order. Only tried a couple of slices today... Margarita & carne. Although it was a big improvement from previous pizza they still need some work. The menu described the margarita pizza as having buffalo mozzarella & San Marzano sauce. None of that was on it. Not even traditional basil that's always on a margarita pizza. Basically plain mozzarella cheese. The carne was as described but nothing special. Both slices were overcooked..very crunchy... Seemed like if done right the crust would have been light & airy.  Slices are reasonable $6/$7. Whole pizzas around $30....which if I would have got the margarita liked they served, I would have sent it back. I will give it another chance after they're open a couple months.

Two words... Hot-Dog!  Hot diggity dog that is surprisingly amazing! The toasted bun pushes this ordinary dog over the top. Perfect ending to a long, late night poker session.

Looking forward to trying other items and hoping they don't get rid of the hot dog the way they did my previous go to item for a light bite to eat.

For a small quick bite this place is a gem! Considering it is in the Bellagio prices are actually reasonable $5 for a slice of white pizza (was actually super bomb no lie) and $11 for a tasty and actually pretty healthy grilled chicken sandwich. There is a variety of interesting burgers that I could see people losing their minds over in the early A.M. after tossing back a few. I'm eyeing the katsu burger myself personally. The funny thing is it's the French fries that are actually kind of pricey. $4.50 for a bowl of fresh cut fries I say skip it and get another slice of white pizza!

This is a small restaurant right next to the main casino area.  It has a nice feel but can get crowded.  It is set up like a fast food type establishment but has some high tech equipment for ordering.  The wait staff were polite and had a good since of humor.  

M Life Military members: For those of us that served in the military almost every restaurant in the Bellagio gave us a 10% discount (it shows Military/Veteran on the M Life Card)

The food was good, we had a double burger with cheese wrapped in lettuce, a regular burger, and to drink one tea and an Adult Chata Shake.  Both burgers were good, I loved the Chata Shake, it was very convenient, and there was no need to make a reservation (it was just under $50 for 2 people).

We would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Las Vegas for a quick bite.

Glad to have found a place that makes fresh food and isn't too heavily priced. We still ended up paying $32.xx for the snack fries with egg and buffalo wings and a soda (refillable), which is pricey in my book. But still its more reasonable than the other restaurants around.

The only reason why I'm giving them 4 stars and not 5 is how salty the wings and fries were. I found myself parched before I even ate and as I was eating, even more desperate for a gallon of water to balance my salt levels. Lol. 

But, flavor was absolutely delicious. They REALLY NEED TO CUT DOWN the SALT. 

OVERALL. convenient, friendly, fast, semi fresh, cheaper than the other expensive restaurants around. Just tell them to ease up on the sodium...enjoy!

Pretty tight space with a diner feel.  

Ordered a salted caramel shake.  Was pretty good, but not fantastic.  $7.50 + .62 tax = $8.12.  Expensive, but as expected at a nice hotel.

I was actually pretty surprised with this place. Consider it's on the strip, at the Bellagio, and you're looking for something quick to eat and that won't cost an arm and a leg.  At snacks, it's not just candy bars and potato chip bags.  You have creative burger and pizza items alongside some pretty awesome french fry variations.

First, to save time, the menu selection is a touchable screen before you approach the cashier.  It gives you your options of what you would like to have included or removed from your item.  For example, a lot of the burgers come with it's specific ingredients to make for a pretty good burger.  For the socal burger, don't forget to include the kale which is part of the burger.  The combination of the chile and the kale with a unique bun make it a treat, a good treat.  The pizza is not your all time greatest pizza but it's much much better pizza than what you find at those mall pizza spots.  Ugh, I can't stand those!

Pricing? Much more affordable than stopping at any of the restaurants off the strip, especially among any of the other food spots at the Bellagio.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND, if you're at the Bellagio and you can't wait to go anywhere else or walk another half mile anywhere for food, and you want to save some money and make it quick so you can catch up with your spouse, friend, group, whatever, definitely stop by Snacks.  You can find it when facing the Bellagio, it's on the north side near Flamingo road and the valet by the casino and the fancy jewelry windows.  Keep an eye out, you'll find it.

Since I was craving fries and a snack.  It's the only thing open 24/7 in the Bellagio.
We ordered the Korean chicken wings, salt and pepper fries, and the pork belly fries.

I loved the Korean chicken wings and fries.  Not a big fan of the pork belly fries, though.

I liked the ordering process the most! Touchscreen monitors to order what you wanted before you proceed to the cashier. It's fool proof.

Stopped in for a quick meal. We liked being able to order exactly what we wanted off the touch screen. My boyfriend got a burger and I got a slice a pizza. Not the largest selection of food choices but the food was good. Staff Zach was great!! Very friendly and helpful! We sat next to a few other people and actually had a good conversation with them while waiting on our food. Glad we stopped in!

We wanted to get something quick before the O show; and since Bellagio really has no options for that we settled for Snacks. We ordered the burger, sweet potatoes fries and pork belly nachos. Do NOT get the pork belly nachos. Very tasteless and the chips are stale. It's a nice place but not worth the wait and the price. I would put your walking shoes on and go somewhere else.

If all you want is a burger and/or pizza, for the love of all that's holy, get out of this hotel and go anywhere else! The burger was no better than a Big Mac but here at the Bellagio, it costs $9.50!!!

Something to grab pass midnight. The the spicy wings, pepperoni pizza and a pork nachos. Wings had a good spice, lack of flavor in the pizza (dipped pizza in wing sauce). Pork nachos were too creamy... can't complain much at 3am though.

Really great burgers and pizza. I was shocked a round the clock little place like this could crank out such great food. Service was also awesome. Definitely recommend it for a quick bite.Bonus... drinks are free refills.

So my girlfriend a day I were in Vegas for a conference. We were looking for a quick place to eat and heard about this place.. Oops wrong choice .

We ordered 3 pizzas between the two of us and a sweet potatoe fries. The pizza was served cold and tasted stale. We couldn't take it so the third pizza we sent back and requested it to be heated. They did and they gave us a new hot piece.. So we were happier, but the pizza was still a solid OK.  The fries were super greasy and we couldn't finish them. 


Blah

Their margherita pizza is excellent 4.5/5
Burger was ok 4/5
Fries did not like. 2.5/5
Drinks way too expensive
We needed a quick bit before we went for O the snack fries with braised beef were unreal! Bit expensive but hey it Vegas!

I'm just trying to save you from a terrible mistake. We thought this would be a good place for a quick bite. The pizza doesn't even taste like food, the burger was terrible. The loaded fries were the only palatable menu item we tried. Fast service but terrible food.

While in Vegas I try to find affordable options for lunch dining. This was a small place with a very simple menu. The food is moderately priced for what it is but it's definitely somewhere I will return.

We paid $22 for a tiny sparkling water, a raspberry iced tea, and 6 non-crispy wings with way too spicy of sauce. 

The pre-order line was a nice idea, but still very slow. When we first walked over, a bunch of the tables were dirty and stacked with dishes. The tables were cleaned before we sat down, but still only felt moderately clean. 

We would not come back here.

Came here to eat after everything else was closed. I ordered the wings and they seemed to be way too spicy! The double burger was very good and so is their pizza! Prices aren't that bad considering it's the Bellagio. Food isn't all that healthy but when nothing else is open it's better than nothing!

The worst establishment I've stepped into in a "good" Vegas atmosphere. Extremely disappointed in the service,food, and EVERYTHING. The young man at the counter not only acted arrogant but when told he got the order wrong (my wife is allergic to dairy which was mentioned multiple times) he adamantly stood by what he believed was correct. 20 min later the correct order came out but he decided to put it on the "heating test" while I sat at the counter as if a show of defiance. As an end result the meats were not cooked fully, chicken wings as well, and the fries has particles of cheese on them even AFTER taking the order back to correct. Margherita pizza was amazing tho  (I can eat dairy). Will never purchase from establishment again will
Always recommend other places to eat in the future.

This was incredibly convenient and hit the spot. With a name like Snacks, I assumed healthy options would be at a minimum, but I was wrong. There is a new kale quinoa salmon salad available (in fact it's so new that it isn't even listed on the touch screen menu as of yet). It is pre-made, but if you're hungry for something healthy and you can't wait for a sit down meal, this is perfect.

The salmon wasn't the best I've ever had, but the salad itself more than makes up for it. The sun dried tomatoes gave the salad a nice flavor, as did the crushed red pepper and Parmesan cheese available in individual packets at the condiment station.

The staff is friendly, too. I would consider coming back here. I left pleasantly surprised and with a full tummy.
I just needed something cold to drink and Alonso told me about free refills.  This allowed me to chill in the nearby sports book.
Food should be better in a 5 star resort. Pizza was not good and more expensive than 50/50 Pizza next door at Aria.

I only recently started coming here to Snacks religiously in the past year when I've been staying here at the Bellagio.  It's a hidden gem right next to The Bank and the sports book and it's a great place to get great food.  The food is relatively affordable (for Vegas) as well.  Great alternative for those that are looking for a quick bite.

Once you get in there are 3 tablets on your right where you can order.  Those that are less tech savvy might take a little longer to navigate through the system but also finding where certain dishes are might take some time as well.  Once you have completed your order a receipt prints out with a bar code that they scan later on at the register.  After you pay they give you a pager and then in about 5-10 minutes later you'll get your food ready to go.  There aren't many tables in the restaurant area itself but it also depends on how busy it is.

The sandwiches are really good here.  I've tried the Big Tuna Burger as well as the Katsu (Chicken covered in panko) sandwich.  Can't go wrong with either.  The Snack Fries with Egg is something that's worth trying, it's fries with gravy and meat and also with an egg on top.

I have tried this convenient spot a couple of times while play poker over at Bellagio. 

The corn chowder was good.

The pork belly nachos were great! 

For just something to just have a great light dinner inside of Bellagio it is very well worth it.
Typical bellagio restaurant. Over priced n below average foods.  Custard milk shake was good but not for 8 bucks b4 tax

Very cool ordering system. You order from a screen and pay and bring the ticket to the counter where they make the food. Too bad the food itself was a bit lackluster. The pizza was dry, the fries a bit stale, and not much to rave about. It's probably the cheapest option you have at Bellagio though so that itself could be worth consideration. Probably wouldn't come back unless I need a quick bite.
Good wings. Perfect after clubbing definitely hit the spot. Service was good and fast despite its huge crowd from the other people from clubbing. Dankkkk

Great spot if your need a quick service meal. Pizza slices are pretty descent but their snack fries is great just right amount of crunch and savory topping. Most times their customer service is on point. However it can get busy depending if there is a large convention in town or patrons for The Bank Night Club next door.
40+ minute wait for a slice of cheese pizza and fries. There was no line when I ordered which means something is seriously wrong in the kitchen

Just stayed at the Bellagio this weekend and ate the chef prepared food ... this is not your regular quick food pickup joint. The classic burger with the "homemade" Hawaiian bun is ridiculous. The bun is soft and sweet and the combination of meet and toppings makes this burger one of the best burgers on the strip at a great price. You have to get the sweet potato waffle fries. The pizza is awesome as well. This is a great place to eat.

To say that this place is a cluster f&$k is an understatement. To begin with their ordering system is the dumbest thing ever. You order from a computer screen prior to getting to the register to pay. Once you make it to the register the cluster f&$kness only gets worst. There is total chaos in this place. I think a cue ball has more personality than this bunch of winners working here. There people all over waiting to get their food, because of the way you order the food. Once I managed to get to the register and pay, the guy helping me was the least friendly person ever, anywhere in the world. I wasn't that hungry, but because the group I was with wanted something of substance, since we were getting ready to go out in town and explore the true Vegas experience(get white girl wasted), we decided to get some quick food here. The only thing I ordered was a lemon danish, since again I wasn't that hungry. As I am about to pay the guy at the register looked at order and said "I have to refund you your money, since we ran out of danishes this morning after breakfast".  The classy piece of work never even tried to apologize. Here is one of my issues here. If you were out of danishes since breakfast, why didn't anyone take the time to take it off the ordering menu? You have to order from basically an iPad. So I just simply said out loud to myself " man that sucks I don't even get to eat anything". The choad at the register looked at me and fought not to laugh at me. Stay away this place is garbage.

Yeah. Everything was cold. Cold pizza, cold "warm" cookie. Lame pre made salad, at least that's supposed to be cold.

I don't do a lot of bad reviews, but this just turned out to be so bad I had to put it out there as soon as I got up to my room.

First and last of all you can not sell pastorized
Orange juice as fresh squized orange juice when you busted you can not say that's what we have
Your menu clearly says fresh squized orange juice not pastorized so clearly sucked for sure

In hotel restaurant. You walk through and order or a kiosk and then pay. We had a group of about 12 and somehow about 5 of our orders just got completely skipped. Groups after us started getting their food and even once we asked about it, it still took over 30 min to get our food. We all just ordered breakfast sandwiches so they weren't even cooking anything. No excuse for that poor service.
Really fast service and great food. A little pricey for burgers and onion rings but you have to realize what hotel you're in. Highly recommend! Will be coming back again for sure

The pizza here is really good, but what I really like and crave right now is the tropical parfait. It gets busy here, but the line moves quick. The employee here are really friendly. It is right next to the bank night club I believe is what it's call.

I don't like to give 1 stars but I must in order for this place to improve and others won't come here until it's better. 
We ordered 3 slices of pizza, 2 drinks and small fries, a total of $42 dollars. The pizza was extremely stale, cold to say the least and just ok. The sweet potato fries were dropping in oil. 

The ladies in the front not very customer service oriented. Maybe they were having a bad day...... 

Point here, do not recommend and will not come back.

We wanted to grab a quick to-go meal and found this little gem inside the Bellagio Hotel.  How genius is this place. Orders are automated, using a touchpad you can order just about anything on the menu. I was craving a burger, so that's what I got. I kinda went crazy and started clicking all kinds of options and upgrades just like a kid in a candy store. So after you place your order, all you do is go to the cashier and everything is rung up already, they are there just waiting to take your money. Our wait wasn't long at all, very efficient and packaged well. The self seating area isn't that big, so you may have to wait to swoop in. You gotta have a fast eye though, as soon as seats vacate, there are people ready to pounce. We got to our room and the burger was to die for. Very juicy, but not overly to where the bun gets soaked. Fries were crispy and the onion rings were huge. Definitely a pit stop on my next visit.

We were going to see "O" at Bellagio and the buffet line was extremely long so we decided to go with a quick bite.  We expected it would be pricey due to Vegas strip prices.  The burger was a bit dried but not too salty.  It's passable.  Pizza was surprisingly better than we thought.  We had some ones where it feels like ketchup smothered on dough.  The kids ate decent enough to hold them over the show.

Everyone's a winner!! 
I stopped for a quick breakfast "snack" and was absolutely delighted with "the #1 Classic" breakfast sandwich. This was really a breakfast burger with Nueske's bacon substituted for a beef patty. I gotta say, I never missed it. If you are from Wisconsin like I am, you know about Nueske's legendary bacon!Tons of melted cheese paired with a scrambled egg gave me all the protein I will need to lose my ass in the casinos later today. This might have been the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had, and I've had plenty. Prices are about what you would expect for the Bellagio: $10.49 for the sandwich and $4.49 for coffee. This is a nice little casual spot in. High end casino. They specialize in craft burgers here and it really shows in their breakfast sandwich!

My buddies and I stayed at the Bellagio one weekend and we literally went to Snacks for all of our meals. It started out with us simply just wanting to grab a quick bite to eat before we start drinking. We stumbled upon this place and decided to try it out since it was close to our room. What a game-changing decision that was for us. 

The food was amazing. We had the Double Cheese Burger, Katsu Burger, Wings, Pork Belly Nachos, Onion Rings, and Snack Fries. I highly recommend the Katsu Burger. For only $12-$13, you get four healthy slices of chicken katsu that were perfectly fried between two toasted Brioche buns. I think I had about three of them in one weekend. The Snack Fries were a little too soggy for my taste with the all the gravy, melted cheese, and meat they put on there, but my buddies all enjoyed it very much. 

Definitely stop by here for a quick late night snack to fulfill your drunchies before heading up to your room. You won't regret it!

The food is not good but it is convenient and open late. The pizza was a little better than I thought based on how it looked but so greasy and not worth $6.50 per slice. Yikes!  We also ordered wings and they were so yucky. They were dry and very poor quality. If you want great pizza close by, head over to the Aria and check out Five50 pizza. Amazing!

This llace is ok for a quick bite in the morining... I would have hoped the oj to be fresh, but it isn't!!! They have a pretty good muffin... This is one I always have before leaving Vegas.. Service is ok, the place is clean and they do have several choices for snacks, breakfast... 
Enjoy
Good food, good quality and fast service, always open late. But way overpriced for what you get.

Some hearty, fatty, late night snacks before heading up to our room for the night after the plane ride. But way overpriced for very mediocre quality food. $45 for a burger, hot dog, wings, and two slices of pizza Especially the pizza slices -- very small, thin, and lacked sauce and cheese. If the $9.50 burger came with fries, it would have been a slightly better deal, as well as the pizza being a little bigger/thicker and more decadent with more sauce/cheese. Paying for food is never a problem, but not for dinky little items. I will say that I thoroughly enjoyed the hot dog. A thicker hot dog, personally reminded me of the 1/4 lb. beef hot dogs from Wawa's, and a sturdy, toasted bun. 

Extremely nice workers, very pleasant and helpful. Have plenty of condiments available (mayo, ketchup, mustard), packets of relish, salt/peppers, napkins, and plastic utensils. 

Also love that you can order at the self- kiosks and pay for it at the register. 

Around 11:30 PM, it was pretty empty in there, so it was peaceful and quiet waiting for our food. A steady flow of people came to get food/dine- in, as it's the only 24 hour option I believe within the hotel (?) Cute lighting, lots of wooden tables, a wall of faux chalkboard writing, a bar seating that looks out into the casino, 

Definitely worth coming here for a quick late night snack, but I would personally only stick to a hot dog and maybe a chocolate shake.

As others have said I was looking for a quick meal at the Bellagio. Very happy that I found it. The KFC (Korean fried wings) were delicious! Had a piece of the Carne pizza as well and was quite please. Less than $20 for dinner at the Bellagio....didn't know that was possible!
They make good food but the burgers a little intense on the onion. A little lame that when buzzed you need to go get your food after dropping $20 on fries and burger. Very clean establishment.

I honestly thought the food was good. The pork belly nachos were a good twist and very original! Wings were hot and crispy! Definitely a good place for snacks. I tried the adult spiked shakes with Jack and I'm so in love! Thank goodness it's in Bellagio!

The ordering system here is less to be desired.  The touch screens are barely responsive and resulted in multiple errors in our order.  The staff quickly rectified the issue and apologize multiple times.  Front line employees should not have to take the brunt for someone's bad decision to cut corners with implementing the touch screen order system.  Thank you to the employees, assistant manager and manager for quickly resolving the issue.

21 minute ticket time for 2 slices of pizza and French fries(all of which were already made) not sure what took so long because they weren't warm when we got them. Reminded me of a college cafeteria. If you want food, you will get it. Just cold and it'll take a little while. Not spectacular

Ugh... This was one of those meals that I'd like to forget ever happened. After a night out in Vegas, I stopped at Snacks to grab some food before heading to bed. It's a quick option that's open all night in the Bellagio.

I got an order of wings and fries, which was ready in about five minutes. After the first bite I had to drink almost a whole bottle of water from how salty it was. I literally only took two more bites before just forgoing the entire dish. They literally must have dipped these wings in salt three times before serving it. I can't even tell you if the sauce was good because it was so salty I couldn't taste anything else.

I see no benefits of coming here unfortunately, unless it's the middle of the night, you're starving and need something quick to eat. If that's the case, grab a slice a pizza instead, which is also served here.
Good food. Came out fast. But of course had Vegas strip prices. $18 for a chicken sandwich and fries
The by the slice pizza was some of the best I have had on the strip. Customer service was great and it was quick.
Great place for a burger or pizza. Ordering on the touch screen then having to go to the register anyway doesn't seem to save time. It's still kinda slow.
